description: This course explores the everydayness of psychopathy in American culture. Emphasizing a psychoanalytic-Marxist methodology, the course analyzes how psychopathy gets normalized in various subcultures, inhibiting collective attempts at social justice. Areas to be explored include psychology, criminality, political economy, and the ethics of psychopathy. Texts and films/television series to be analyzed may include Dexter,Batman,The Talented Mr. Ripley, True Detective (season one), and American Psycho. Offered alternate years during Interim. Prerequisite: FYW.
name: Psychopathy in American Culture
